name: Login with Azure (Azure SSO)
author: miniOrange

sections.description:
The WordPress Login with Azure (Azure SSO) plugin simplifies the authentication process, enabling WordPress AzureAD SSO and WordPress AzureB2C Login through Azure account credentials. Utilizing OAuth / OpenID Connect protocol, this plugin offers a robust solution for secure Login to WordPress.

Single Sign-On(SSO)

SSO allows users to access multiple applications with one set of credentials, enhancing the Azure Login experience. This feature is particularly beneficial for organizations using Azure as their identity provider (azure idp), enabling Azure SAML based authentication for a streamlined Azure B2C SSO process.

For more details on OAuth, OpenID Connect ( OIDC ), Security Tokens, please visit Microsoft Azure website .

Use-cases

Our plugin extends its functionality to various Azure users, supporting WordPress Office365 SSO and allowing Azure AD, Azure B2C, and external users to seamlessly login into WordPress. This wide-ranging support makes our plugin a versatile solution for Azure B2C login and Azure AD SSO, covering multiple scenarios like:
* Single Sign-On to WordPress using Azure AD users ( Azure AD SSO )
* Single Sign-On to WordPress using Azure B2C users ( Azure B2C SSO )
* Single Sign-On to WordPress using external users synced to Azure AD ( Azure AD SSO )
* Single Sign-On to WordPress using Office 365 users ( Office 365 SSO )
* Single Sign-On to WordPress using Dynamics CRM users ( Dynamics CRM SSO )
* Single Sign-On to WordPress using Microsoft Teams users ( Microsoft Teams SSO )
* Single Sign-On to WordPress using Windows Live users ( Windows Live SSO )

SSO FEATURES

  • WordPress Login with Azure ( Azure SSO ) supports Single Sign-On(SSO) with Azure AD / Azure B2C / Office 365 / Dynamic CRM / Microsoft Teams / Windows Live / using OAuth / OpenID Connect ( OIDC ) protocols
  • WordPress Login with custom Applications.
  • Auto Create Users : After SSO, new user automatically gets created in WordPress
  • Account Linking : After user SSO to WordPress, if user already exists in WordPress, then his profile gets updated or it will create a new WordPress User
  • Attribute Mapping : Login with Azure supports Attribute Mapping feature to map WordPress user profile attribute.
  • Login Widget : Use Widgets to easily integrate the login link with your WordPress site
  • Redirect URL after Login : OAuth Login Automatically Redirects user after successful login.
  • Multi-tenant support
  • Support for Azure MFA
  • Support for an integration with Graph API
  • Support for standard and custom policies like Password Reset ( Forgot Password ) , Sign Up and Sign In Policy, etc
  • Real Time User Provisioning using APIs or SCIM

SharePoint Integration

  • Integration with SharePoint and OneDrive : Quickly add and sync SharePoint and OneDrive documents to your WordPress site. This makes it simple for your team to work with documents and files directly in WordPress, keeping everything organized in one place.

  • Smart File Management : Keep your SharePoint and OneDrive files organized in WordPress. Work with other plugins like BuddyPress and WooCommerce to control who can see and access files based on their role, where they’re from, or if they’re a paid member.

  • Connect with Microsoft365/Office 365 Apps : Set up other Microsoft365/Office 365 apps like Power BI and Microsoft Teams to work with your WordPress site. Use Microsoft Graph APIs to make everything work together smoothly.

  • Automatic Content Updates and Alerts : Real-time synchronization between WordPress and SharePoint. Whenever you update or upload files, folders, etc., on your SharePoint sites, the identical updates will be reflected on your WordPress site instantly, and the same process applies in reverse.

  • Secure Your Documents and Folders : Keep your SharePoint and OneDrive files safe by hiding the direct links in WordPress. This way, only people who should see your files can access them.

  • Sync User Profiles and Sites : Seamlessly sync user data, sites, drives, and folder information from SharePoint to WordPress, while also enabling the updating and uploading of files from WordPress to SharePoint.

  • Flexible File Handling and Sharing : Enable only authenticated users to directly edit SharePoint documents from your WordPress site using our Single Sign-On (SSO) functionality. The plugin allows for the downloading and sharing of file previews through direct links. Enhance your website’s appeal by publishing the latest news and events from SharePoint on your WordPress platform.

No SSL restriction

  • Login to WordPress ( WordPress SSO ) using Azure without having an SSL or HTTPS enabled site.

Add-Ons Supported

  • Page Restriction Add-On to secure access to your WordPress pages / posts
  • Buddypress Attribute Mapping Add-On
  • LearnDash Attribute Integration Add-On
  • Azure Integrator
  • Media Restriction Add-On
  • Attribute based Redirection
  • SCIM-User Provisioning
  • SSO Session Management
  • SSO Login Audit
sections.installation:
From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit Plugins > Add New
  2. Search for azure. Find and Install Login with Azure or ‘Azure SSO’ plugin by miniOrange
  3. Activate the plugin

From WordPress.org

  1. Download WordPress Login with Azure ( Azure SSO ).
  2. Unzip and upload the Login with Azure directory to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  3. Activate Login with Azure from your Plugins page.

Once Activated

  1. Go to Settings-> miniOrange Login with Azure -> Configure SSO, and follow the instructions
  2. Go to Appearance->Widgets ,in available widgets you will find miniOrange Login with Azure widget, drag it to chosen widget area where you want it to appear.
  3. Now visit your site and you will see login with widget.
sections.faq:
How to configure WordPress Azure SSO?

  • Download and install Login with Azure(Azure SSO) plugin.
  • Add your Redirect/Callback URL from WordPress Login with Azure plugin, into your AzureAD/ AzureB2C application.
  • Provide the required fields(ClientID, Client Secret, TenantID/ Tenant-Name, Policy-Name) from your AzureAD/ AzureB2C application to the WP Login with Azure Plugin on your WordPress site for a successful WordPress-Azure SSO connection.

I am not able to configure the Azure SSO with provided settings

Please email us at samlsupport@xecurify.com or Contact us. You can also submit your app request from the plugin’s configuration page.

For any query/problem/request

Visit Troubleshooting section in the plugin OR email us at info@xecurify.com or Contact us. You can also submit your query from the plugin’s configuration page.
